result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl M Coleman

records.addlTxt: Effective August 3, 2020, this case is assigned to Branch 5, the Honorable J. Arthur Melvin, pursuant to 20-SO-01(67).
Letter from Atty Kees advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant
Defendant Carl M Coleman not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant remains active.

Attorney Sam Benedict, for attorney Anna M Kees in court.   Defendant Carl M Coleman did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Case scheduled for 10:30 am; matter called at 10:37 am.  Atty. Benedict advises that he did talk to the defendant and he is unable to make court today due to car issues.  Atty. Benedict advises, and State confirms, that the up front resitution has not been paid by the defendant.  Court will issue a capias and orders bail be revoked.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Sam Benedict, for attorney Anna M Kees in court.   Defendant Carl M Coleman did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Benedict advises that his office was contacted by the defendant this morning advising that due to a ride issue he will not be able to make court today.  Atty. Benedict requests the matter be adjourned for plea and sentencing.  Court reviews case notes on the record.  State advises that restitution has not been paid yet.  Court will authorize but stay the issuance of a capias and adjourn for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2018 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Carl M Coleman in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kees advises the court of the status of the case and is requesting the matter be adjourned and set for plea/sentencing.  State has no objection to the request.  Court adjourns for the last time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 25, 2018 at 10:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Cole Altman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Anna M Kees by Atty. Crawford in court.   
Defendant Carl M Coleman did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by authorization.

State's offer is predicated on payment of up front restitution.
Per the court - No More Adjournments.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2018 at 09:30 am.

File not called on the record. Attorney Anna M Kees in court.   Defendant Carl M Coleman did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 7, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Carl M Coleman in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kees indicates that her client is working on paying the restitution and requests an adjournment.  Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Restitution hearing on March 19, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Anna M Kees in court by authorization.   Defendant Carl M Coleman did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kees requests a new date for plea and sentence and it also be set for a restitution hearing.  Court grants.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 19, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 15, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Filed by Atty. Kees - State and Defense have reached an agreement - Requesting an adjournment for 30 - 45 days (to pay up front restitution) for Plea and Sentencing. **Request for additional time granted.**
